conclusion: There are four identical wooden blocks, labeled A, B, C, and D. Blocks A and B are stacked, as are blocks C and D. Blocks B and C are connected by a light spring. A horizontal force F is applied to block B.

premise: All blocks are accelerating together with the same acceleration a.
conclusion: Consider the entire system as a rigid body.

premise: The total force applied to the system is F. The total mass of the system is 4m.
Block D is part of the system and is accelerating with the same acceleration a.
conclusion: The force causing block D to accelerate is the static friction force f.
Relate the force to the acceleration.
Substitute the acceleration: f = m * (F / 4m) = F / 4.

premise: The magnitude of the static friction force acting on block D is F / 4.
conclusion: The magnitude of the static friction force acting on block D during the acceleration process is F / 4.
